intro: Urochlaena, commonly known as the arrowhead vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their heart-shaped leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Urochlaena species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in moist, shaded environments. They are climbing plants that use tendrils to support their growth along trees or structures. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
